title: Philips shares slump as connected-care business hit by tariffs
text: Shares of Philips Electronics PHIA, -7.98% tumbled 8% in early Amsterdam as the company issued a warning over its connected care business, which had a 4.5-point decline in its adjusted margin during the third quarter. Philips blamed "increasing headwinds from tariffs and a delay in the impact of the mitigating actions, factory under-coverage as production levels were lowered to reduce inventory, and an adverse product mix impact." For the year, the company expects margin improvement of 10 to 20 basis points, after three consecutive years of at least 100 basis points rises.
